tree_elements.text: To the Editors: Arishtha Dey and Deepa Srinidhi

While reading your compelling article, I started to think about why this show was given so much “hype.” I have watched this show before and thoroughly enjoyed it. While many may compare it to other shows, Squid Game is a unique concept, something that a producer has never made before and a storyline that has never been done before.

Viewers were also drawn in through the countless themes that were shown through the show. While it did show the importance of money, even throughout other countries like South Korea; it depicted real-world issues such as poverty and capitalism which people were able to connect to. The games that were played were also easy to connect to as they were children’s games.

Thus, I understand why people were so addicted to Squid Game. While it wasn’t in English causing some difficulty, it was a unique story. As Coco Chanel stated, “In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.”

file_structural_elements.title: Re: “Squid Game: Is it worth the hype?” (Nov. 16, 2021)
